channel.title: Efficient AI on Baam's Techlog
channel.description: Recent content in Efficient AI on Baam's Techlog

item.title: Low Rank Adaptation
item.description: Why Low Rank Adaptation Matters: A Closer Look at Its Impact on Machine Learning Low Rank Adaptation (LoRA) is a fine-tuning technique designed to efficiently update and adapt large pre-trained models, such as language or diffusion models, without retraining them entirely. Low Rank Adaptation was proposed in 2021 by Edward Hu et al. They demonstrated that LoRA significantly reduces the number of trainable parameters and GPU memory requirements. But how is that possible?
